result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah J Sorensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will comply with all programming recommended by DOC Agent, with focus on areas of Domestic Abuse.

Court will order a DNA sample, will waive surcharge.

Court will waive court costs.

Court will not grant expunction.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaiah J Sorensen in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Defendant Isaiah J Sorensen in custody.  Lester H Liptak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM121, 15CM183-all sentencing after revocation.  17CM104-RH,  17CF62-arraignment.  17CF76, 17CF77-Initial Appearance.  Waive reading of CC's ask for PH,  DE/Atty will waive TL for PH, court instructs on waiver of TL, court will accept waiver.  Set CF cases for PH, other cases for RH.  Will proceed to arraignment in 17CF62-waive reading of information, enter a plea of NG to all counts.  Atty asking for $50.00 cash bond, State asks for $250.00 cash bond.  The cpurt will order a $250.00 cash bond concurrent on each case, no contact with Gateway Apts and Lodge.  

Sentencing after revocation on the following cases.  No additions or corrections to the Revocation packet from either side.  Parties enter argument on sentencing.  DE reads prepared statement to the court.  

15CM69-90 days jail

15CM121-90 days jail

15CM183-90 days jail   all jail concurrent.   DE has credit for 54 days.  Civil judgment for unpaid court obligations.  Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 25, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR

Defendant Isaiah J Sorensen in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM121, 15CM122, 15CM182, 15CM183, 16CT7.  Agreement has been reached, Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

15CM69-CT 1-DRI
                CT 2-NC,Court will accept, find DE guilty

15CM121-CT 1-DRI
                  CT 2-NC, Court accepts, guilty

15CM122-DRI
15CM182-DRI
 
15CM183-CT'S 1,2,4-DRI
                  CT 3-NC, Court accepts, guilty.

16CT7-DRI

Court will accept the recommendations of the parties, will order sentence withheld, 2 years probation on each Ct, will provide a DNA sample/ no cost of surcharge, will comply with all programming recommended by DOC agent focusing in the area of Dometic Abuse.  DE has credit for 11 days.  Court will waive Court costs.  Court will not grant request for expunction at this time.

Defendant Isaiah J Sorensen in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM69, 15CM122, 15CM182, 15CM183.  15CM182, 15CM183-Init App, waive reading enter a plea of NG.  Bonds will be concurrent in all cases.  Set for RH 1-26-16 @ 3:00PM.

Defendant Isaiah J Sorensen in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James J Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM121, 15CM122.  New complaints will be filed per the state.  Set or RH 12-14-15 @ 2:00PM.

Defendant Isaiah J Sorensen in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM121, 15CM122-Init App.  15CM121, 15CM122-  Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  Bonds concurrent in all cases, bond continues.  Set for 10-12-15 @ 1:00PM
